creator: florin.neagoe@gefco.fr
text:
Hello,

I use the FOP in command line to generate a .TXT file.
But, to the end , after the generation of file, exist some lines which are 
write one over one, so I have 2 line into the same line. All the lines are into 
the distints blocks <fo:block>.

I think that my probleme is a FOP bug.

A+
Florin

It's not a bug, it's a feature.
Even if you output text, layout is done like for every other format. THe
TXT renderer then puts the laid out content on a coarse grid determined by
the characters-per-line and line-per-page parameters. It may happen that
lines fall on top of each other.
creator: j3322ptm@yahoo.de

text: batch transition to closed remaining pre-FOP1.0 resolved bugs
creator: gadams@apache.org
